Problem 39. If A ⊂Z/pZ is random, |A| = √p, can we almost surely cover Z/pZ
with 100√p translates of A?
Comments. This is a problem I posed in Barbados in 2010. I do not know how to
answer this even with 100 replaced by 1.01. Similar questions are interesting with
√p replaced by pθ for any θ ⩽1
2. A problem in much the same vein, but possibly
more natural, is to take a group G and choose A ⊂G × G, |A| = |G| at random.
For references to related matters see [34].
